page.title: 08DAY IN THE LIFE OF A CHILD
page.content: The typical Doddinghurst child comes from a home where mother{works}part- time. Unemployment in this area is low and most children do not lack for material needs. All of the{houses}are equipped with modern facilities. According to our survey, television is the most important feature of {leisure}in the home. Everyone owns at least one T.V. and about 80% have a video. The children spend between 1 and 3 hours a day watching television. The day begins at about 7.30am when the child plays or reads in their own bedroom. During the week breakfast is self-service but at the weekend the family eats together. Father leaves for{work}between 7-7:30 a.m. and the child at about 8:30. After school the child plays out with friends or at home with toys or with their home computer.
